thread.title: Conor McGregor takes another swipe at Floyd Mayweather ahead of possible super-fight - 'I run every game'
thread.title_full: Conor McGregor takes another swipe at Floyd Mayweather ahead of possible super-fight - 'I run every game'

author: Liam Prenderville
title: Conor McGregor takes another swipe at Floyd Mayweather ahead of possible super-fight - 'I run every game'
text:
Conor McGregor (Photo: Getty Images/www.splashnews.com) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Conor McGregor has taken another swipe at Floyd Mayweather as their super-fight edges closer. 
UFC star McGregor and the former world champion boxer have both hinted at a fight, which would take place in a the ring, not the Octagon. 
Reports emerged earlier this week suggesting an agreement had been reached between the two men. Mayweather has since denied this is the case, claiming he is "happily retired". 
McGregor insists he is pursuing the fight though and has sent another message out to Mayweather on Instagram. 
He posed alongside former UFC owner Lorenzo Fertitta and warned: "Nobody in the history of the fight game has come up as fast and as young as I have. https://www.instagram.com/p/BQjmSiWB4ND/embed 
"I now, at 28 years of age, have my eyes firmly set on the 'highest paid fighter' and 'highest earning athlete' accolades. 
"Understand and respect what you are witnessing here. Because not one of you can do nothing to stop it." 
McGregor uploaded another image as he continues his trip to Las Vegas alongside the caption "I run every game." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
